Fulk of Toulouse, poet, jongleur, monk, and then Cistercian abbot of Florege, was created Bishop of Toulouse in 1206. In 1212 he was driven from his diocese by heretics and went to preach the crusade in Flanders. His interest in religious women's communities as a bulwark against heresy led him to support Dominic's foundation at Prouille and it was at his request that Jacques de Vitry wrote the life of Mary of Oignies
